trans-unit.source: Represents a control that can be dragged by the user.

The Thumb control can be included in another control, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control, to let the user change the control's value.
The Thumb can also be used to resize controls.
For example, a Thumb control in the corner of a window can provide a location for the user to click with the mouse to start a resize operation.

Thumb provides <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragStarted>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragCompleted> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragDelta> events to manage drag operations associated with the mouse pointer.
When the user presses the left mouse button, the Thumb control receives logical focus and mouse capture, and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragStarted> event is raised.
While the Thumb control has focus and mouse capture, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragDelta> event can be raised multiple times without limit.
When the user releases the left mouse button, the Thumb control loses mouse capture and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragCompleted> event is raised.
The event information provides a change in position, but does not reposition the Thumb.
You must manually change or reposition the Thumb or any other elements that you want to resize or change as a result of the drag operation.
The Thumb control does not provide drag-and-drop functionality.
A Thumb control can receive mouse capture, but cannot receive keyboard focus.
Therefore, the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocused%2A> property that corresponds to keyboard focus is set to `false`.
This value overrides the parent class <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control> that sets this property to `true`.

To provide drag capability, class handling is provided for the <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown>, <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonUp> and <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseMove> events.

For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.OnMouseLeftButtonDown%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.OnMouseLeftButtonUp%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.OnMouseMove%2A> methods.
When a Thumb is part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control that scrolls content in a viewable area, or viewport, the size of the Thumb reflects the size of the viewport.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> class.
The following illustration shows a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control that is part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control.

![Scrollbar illustration](~/add/media/scrollbar-illustration.JPG "Scrollbar illustration") ## Customizing the Thumb Control To apply the same property settings to multiple Thumb controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the Thumb, see [Thumb Syles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in Button control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> class.
Cancels a drag operation for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref>.

If a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> has mouse capture and logical focus, this method removes mouse capture and raises a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragCompleted> event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control loses mouse capture.
This DragCompleted event occurs when the left mouse button is released or when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.CancelDrag%2A> method is called.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control receives mouse capture when the user presses the left mouse button while pausing the mouse pointer over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control.

The position of the mouse when the DragCompleted event occurs is provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DragDeltaEventArgs> of the last <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragDelta> event.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragCompleted"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Occurs one or more times as the mouse changes position when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control has logical focus and mouse capture.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control receives focus and mouse capture when the user presses the left mouse button while pausing the mouse pointer over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control loses mouse capture when the user releases the left mouse button, or when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.CancelDrag%2A> method is called.
A new DragDelta event occurs each time the mouse position moves on the screen.
Therefore, this event can be raised multiple times without a limit when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control has mouse capture.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragDelta"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control receives logical focus and mouse capture.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control receives focus and mouse capture when the user presses the left mouse button while pausing the mouse pointer over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb>.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragStarted"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control has logical focus and mouse capture and the left mouse button is pressed.
When the IsDragging property changes its value, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.OnDraggingChanged%2A> method is called.
Starting with the .NET Framework version 3.0 Service Pack 1, IsDragging has a protected setter.
To use this functionality, your application should target the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control has focus and mouse capture; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.IsDragging*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ThumbAutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control.
Responds to a change in the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.IsDragging*> property.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event.
This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown> event by setting <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> to `true`.

Also, this method gives the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> logical focus and mouse capture, and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.IsDragging%2A> property to `true`.
This implementation also raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragStarted> event.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonUp"></xref> event.
This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown> event by setting <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> to `true`.
Also, this method removes mouse capture from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb>, and sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.IsDragging%2A> property to `false`.
This implementation also raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragCompleted> event.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove"></xref> event.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> has logical focus and mouse capture, this implementation raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb.DragDelta> event when the mouse moves.
In this scenario, the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove> event is handled by setting <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> to `true`.
The event data.
